main: ^Masskara Festival is an annual festival, which is similar to Brazil's Rio Carnival. It literally translates to "many faces". It is celebrated every October in Bacolod, Ilo-Ilo known as City of Smiles.

c-0: ^Maskara derived from the word “mass” (meaning a multitude of people), and the Spanish word cara (meaning face), thus forming MassKara (a multitude of faces).
